segment.source: Implement Microsoft Passport in your organization (Windows 10)
segment.target: Implement Microsoft Passport in your organization (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can create a Group Policy or mobile device management (MDM) policy that will implement Microsoft Passport on devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: You can create a Group Policy or mobile device management (MDM) policy that will implement Microsoft Passport on devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: Implement Microsoft Passport in your organization
segment.target: Implement Microsoft Passport in your organization

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: You can create a Group Policy or mobile device management (MDM) policy that will implement Microsoft Passport on devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: You can create a Group Policy or mobile device management (MDM) policy that will implement Microsoft Passport on devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: Important: The Group Policy setting Turn on PIN sign-in does not apply to Windows 10.
segment.target: Important: The Group Policy setting Turn on PIN sign-in does not apply to Windows 10.

segment.source: Use Microsoft Passport for Work policy settings to manage PINs.
segment.target: Use Microsoft Passport for Work policy settings to manage PINs.

segment.source: Group Policy settings for Passport
segment.target: Group Policy settings for Passport

segment.source: The following table lists the Group Policy settings that you can configure for Passport use in your workplace.
segment.target: The following table lists the Group Policy settings that you can configure for Passport use in your workplace.

segment.source: These policy settings are available in Computer ConfigurationPoliciesAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMicrosoft Passport for Work.
segment.target: These policy settings are available in Computer ConfigurationPoliciesAdministrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsMicrosoft Passport for Work.

segment.source: Policy
segment.target: Policy

segment.source: Options
segment.target: Options

segment.source: Use Microsoft Passport for Work
segment.target: Use Microsoft Passport for Work

segment.source: Not configured: Users can provision Passport for Work, which encrypts their domain password.
segment.target: Not configured: Users can provision Passport for Work, which encrypts their domain password.

segment.source: Enabled: Device provisions Passport for Work using keys or certificates for all users.
segment.target: Enabled: Device provisions Passport for Work using keys or certificates for all users.

segment.source: Disabled: Device does not provision Passport for Work for any user.
segment.target: Disabled: Device does not provision Passport for Work for any user.

segment.source: Use a hardware security device
segment.target: Use a hardware security device

segment.source: Not configured: Passport for Work will be provisioned using TPM if available, and will be provisioned using software if TPM is not available.
segment.target: Not configured: Passport for Work will be provisioned using TPM if available, and will be provisioned using software if TPM is not available.

segment.source: Enabled: Passport for Work will only be provisioned using TPM.
segment.target: Enabled: Passport for Work will only be provisioned using TPM.

segment.source: Disabled: Passport for Work will be provisioned using TPM if available, and will be provisioned using software if TPM is not available.
segment.target: Disabled: Passport for Work will be provisioned using TPM if available, and will be provisioned using software if TPM is not available.

segment.source: Use biometrics
segment.target: Use biometrics

segment.source: Not configured: Biometrics can be used as a gesture in place of a PIN.
segment.target: Not configured: Biometrics can be used as a gesture in place of a PIN.

segment.source: Enabled: Biometrics can be used as a gesture in place of a PIN.
segment.target: Enabled: Biometrics can be used as a gesture in place of a PIN.

segment.source: Disabled: Only a PIN can be used as a gesture.
segment.target: Disabled: Only a PIN can be used as a gesture.

segment.source: PIN Complexity
segment.target: PIN Complexity

segment.source: Require digits
segment.target: Require digits

segment.source: Not configured: Users must include a digit in their PIN.
segment.target: Not configured: Users must include a digit in their PIN.

segment.source: Enabled: Users must include a digit in their PIN.
segment.target: Enabled: Users must include a digit in their PIN.

segment.source: Disabled: Users cannot use digits in their PIN.
segment.target: Disabled: Users cannot use digits in their PIN.

segment.source: Require lowercase letters
segment.target: Require lowercase letters

segment.source: Not configured: Users cannot use lowercase letters in their PIN.
segment.target: Not configured: Users cannot use lowercase letters in their PIN.

segment.source: Enabled: Users must include at least one lowercase letter in their PIN.
segment.target: Enabled: Users must include at least one lowercase letter in their PIN.

segment.source: Disabled: Users cannot use lowercase letters in their PIN.
segment.target: Disabled: Users cannot use lowercase letters in their PIN.

segment.source: Maximum PIN length
segment.target: Maximum PIN length

segment.source: Not configured: PIN length must be less than or equal to 127.
segment.target: Not configured: PIN length must be less than or equal to 127.

segment.source: Enabled: PIN length must be less than or equal to the number you specify.
segment.target: Enabled: PIN length must be less than or equal to the number you specify.

segment.source: Disabled: PIN length must be less than or equal to 127.
segment.target: Disabled: PIN length must be less than or equal to 127.

segment.source: Minimum PIN length
segment.target: Minimum PIN length

segment.source: Not configured: PIN length must be greater than or equal to 4.
segment.target: Not configured: PIN length must be greater than or equal to 4.

segment.source: Enabled: PIN length must be greater than or equal to the number you specify.
segment.target: Enabled: PIN length must be greater than or equal to the number you specify.

segment.source: Disabled: PIN length must be greater than or equal to 4.
segment.target: Disabled: PIN length must be greater than or equal to 4.

segment.source: Expiration
segment.target: Expiration

segment.source: Not configured: PIN does not expire.
segment.target: Not configured: PIN does not expire.

segment.source: Enabled: PIN can be set to expire after any number of days between 1 and 730, or PIN can be set to never expire by setting policy to 0.
segment.target: Enabled: PIN can be set to expire after any number of days between 1 and 730, or PIN can be set to never expire by setting policy to 0.

segment.source: Disabled: PIN does not expire.
segment.target: Disabled: PIN does not expire.

segment.source: History
segment.target: History

segment.source: Not configured: Previous PINs are not stored.
segment.target: Not configured: Previous PINs are not stored.

segment.source: Enabled: Specify the number of previous PINs that can be associated to a user account that can't be reused.
segment.target: Enabled: Specify the number of previous PINs that can be associated to a user account that can't be reused.

segment.source: Disabled: Previous PINs are not stored.
segment.target: Disabled: Previous PINs are not stored.

segment.source: Note Current PIN is included in PIN history.
segment.target: Note Current PIN is included in PIN history.

segment.source: Require special characters
segment.target: Require special characters

segment.source: Not configured: Users cannot include a special character in their PIN.
segment.target: Not configured: Users cannot include a special character in their PIN.

segment.source: Enabled: Users must include at least one special character in their PIN.
segment.target: Enabled: Users must include at least one special character in their PIN.

segment.source: Disabled: Users cannot include a special character in their PIN.
segment.target: Disabled: Users cannot include a special character in their PIN.

segment.source: Require uppercase letters
segment.target: Require uppercase letters

segment.source: Not configured: Users cannot include an uppercase letter in their PIN.
segment.target: Not configured: Users cannot include an uppercase letter in their PIN.

segment.source: Enabled: Users must include at least one uppercase letter in their PIN.
segment.target: Enabled: Users must include at least one uppercase letter in their PIN.

segment.source: Disabled: Users cannot include an uppercase letter in their PIN.
segment.target: Disabled: Users cannot include an uppercase letter in their PIN.

segment.source: Remote Passport
segment.target: Remote Passport

segment.source: Use Remote Passport
segment.target: Use Remote Passport

segment.source: Note Applies to desktop only.
segment.target: Note Applies to desktop only.

segment.source: Phone sign-in is currently limited to select Technology Adoption Program (TAP) participants.
segment.target: Phone sign-in is currently limited to select Technology Adoption Program (TAP) participants.

segment.source: Not configured: Remote Passport is disabled.
segment.target: Not configured: Remote Passport is disabled.

segment.source: Enabled: Users can use a portable, registered device as a companion device for desktop authentication.
segment.target: Enabled: Users can use a portable, registered device as a companion device for desktop authentication.

segment.source: Disabled: Remote Passport is disabled.
segment.target: Disabled: Remote Passport is disabled.

segment.source: MDM policy settings for Passport
segment.target: MDM policy settings for Passport

segment.source: The following table lists the MDM policy settings that you can configure for Passport use in your workplace.
segment.target: The following table lists the MDM policy settings that you can configure for Passport use in your workplace.

segment.source: These MDM policy settings use the PassportForWork configuration service provider (CSP).
segment.target: These MDM policy settings use the PassportForWork configuration service provider (CSP).

segment.source: Policy
segment.target: Policy

segment.source: Scope
segment.target: Scope

segment.source: Default
segment.target: Default

segment.source: Options
segment.target: Options

segment.source: UsePassportForWork
segment.target: UsePassportForWork

segment.source: Device
segment.target: Device

segment.source: True
segment.target: True

segment.source: True: Passport will be provisioned for all users on the device.
segment.target: True: Passport will be provisioned for all users on the device.

segment.source: False: Users will not be able to provision Passport.
segment.target: False: Users will not be able to provision Passport.

segment.source: Note If Passport is enabled, and then the policy is changed to False, users who previously set up Passport can continue to use it, but will not be able to set up Passport on other devices.
segment.target: Note If Passport is enabled, and then the policy is changed to False, users who previously set up Passport can continue to use it, but will not be able to set up Passport on other devices.

segment.source: RequireSecurityDevice
segment.target: RequireSecurityDevice

segment.source: Device
segment.target: Device

segment.source: False
segment.target: False

segment.source: True: Passport will only be provisioned using TPM.
segment.target: True: Passport will only be provisioned using TPM.

segment.source: False: Passport will be provisioned using TPM if available, and will be provisioned using software if TPM is not available.
segment.target: False: Passport will be provisioned using TPM if available, and will be provisioned using software if TPM is not available.

segment.source: Biometrics
segment.target: Biometrics

segment.source: UseBiometrics
segment.target: UseBiometrics

segment.source: Device
segment.target: Device

segment.source: False
segment.target: False

segment.source: True: Biometrics can be used as a gesture in place of a PIN for domain logon.
segment.target: True: Biometrics can be used as a gesture in place of a PIN for domain logon.

segment.source: False: Only a PIN can be used as a gesture for domain logon.
segment.target: False: Only a PIN can be used as a gesture for domain logon.

segment.source: FacialFeaturesUser
segment.target: FacialFeaturesUser

segment.source: EnhancedAntiSpoofing
segment.target: EnhancedAntiSpoofing

segment.source: Device
segment.target: Device

segment.source: Not configured
segment.target: Not configured

segment.source: Not configured: users can choose whether to turn on enhanced anti-spoofing.
segment.target: Not configured: users can choose whether to turn on enhanced anti-spoofing.

segment.source: True: Enhanced anti-spoofing is required on devices which support it.
segment.target: True: Enhanced anti-spoofing is required on devices which support it.

segment.source: False: Users cannot turn on enhanced anti-spoofing.
segment.target: False: Users cannot turn on enhanced anti-spoofing.

segment.source: PINComplexity
segment.target: PINComplexity

segment.source: Digits
segment.target: Digits

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: 1: Numbers are not allowed.
segment.target: 1: Numbers are not allowed.

segment.source: 2: At least one number is required.
segment.target: 2: At least one number is required.

segment.source: Lowercase letters
segment.target: Lowercase letters

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: 1: Lowercase letters are not allowed.
segment.target: 1: Lowercase letters are not allowed.

segment.source: 2: At least one lowercase letter is required.
segment.target: 2: At least one lowercase letter is required.

segment.source: Maximum PIN length
segment.target: Maximum PIN length

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: Maximum length that can be set is 127.
segment.target: Maximum length that can be set is 127.

segment.source: Maximum length cannot be less than minimum setting.
segment.target: Maximum length cannot be less than minimum setting.

segment.source: Minimum PIN length
segment.target: Minimum PIN length

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: Minimum length that can be set is 4.
segment.target: Minimum length that can be set is 4.

segment.source: Minimum length cannot be greater than maximum setting.
segment.target: Minimum length cannot be greater than maximum setting.

segment.source: Expiration
segment.target: Expiration

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: Integer value specifies the period of time (in days) that a PIN can be used before the system requires the user to change it.
segment.target: Integer value specifies the period of time (in days) that a PIN can be used before the system requires the user to change it.

segment.source: The largest number you can configure for this policy setting is 730.
segment.target: The largest number you can configure for this policy setting is 730.

segment.source: The lowest number you can configure for this policy setting is 0.
segment.target: The lowest number you can configure for this policy setting is 0.

segment.source: If this policy is set to 0, then the user’s PIN will never expire.
segment.target: If this policy is set to 0, then the user’s PIN will never expire.

segment.source: History
segment.target: History

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: Integer value that specifies the number of past PINs that can be associated to a user account that can’t be reused.
segment.target: Integer value that specifies the number of past PINs that can be associated to a user account that can’t be reused.

segment.source: The largest number you can configure for this policy setting is 50.
segment.target: The largest number you can configure for this policy setting is 50.

segment.source: The lowest number you can configure for this policy setting is 0.
segment.target: The lowest number you can configure for this policy setting is 0.

segment.source: If this policy is set to 0, then storage of previous PINs is not required.
segment.target: If this policy is set to 0, then storage of previous PINs is not required.

segment.source: Special characters
segment.target: Special characters

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: 1: Special characters are not allowed.
segment.target: 1: Special characters are not allowed.

segment.source: 2: At least one special character is required.
segment.target: 2: At least one special character is required.

segment.source: Uppercase letters
segment.target: Uppercase letters

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: 1: Uppercase letters are not allowed
segment.target: 1: Uppercase letters are not allowed

segment.source: 2: At least one uppercase letter is required
segment.target: 2: At least one uppercase letter is required

segment.target: UseRemotePassport

segment.source: Note Applies to desktop only.
segment.target: Note Applies to desktop only.

segment.target: Phone sign-in is currently limited to select Technology Adoption Program (TAP) participants.

segment.source: Device or user
segment.target: Device or user

segment.source: False
segment.target: False

segment.source: True: Remote Passport is enabled.
segment.target: True: Remote Passport is enabled.

segment.source: False: Remote Passport is disabled.
segment.target: False: Remote Passport is disabled.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If policy is not configured to explicitly require letters or special characters, users will be restricted to creating a numeric PIN.
segment.target: If policy is not configured to explicitly require letters or special characters, users will be restricted to creating a numeric PIN.

segment.source: Configuration Manager (current branch) or Configuration Manager 2016 Technical Preview for domain-joined certificate enrollment, or InTune for non-domain-joined devices, or a non-Microsoft MDM service that supports Passport for Work
segment.target: Configuration Manager (current branch) or Configuration Manager 2016 Technical Preview for domain-joined certificate enrollment, or InTune for non-domain-joined devices, or a non-Microsoft MDM service that supports Passport for Work

segment.source: Configuration Manager and MDM provide the ability to manage Passport policy and to deploy and manage certificates protected by Passport.
segment.target: Configuration Manager and MDM provide the ability to manage Passport policy and to deploy and manage certificates protected by Passport.

segment.source: Azure AD provides the ability to register devices with your enterprise and to provision Passport for organization accounts.
segment.target: Azure AD provides the ability to register devices with your enterprise and to provision Passport for organization accounts.

segment.source: Active Directory provides the ability to authorize users and devices using keys protected by Passport if domain controllers are running Windows 10 and the Microsoft Passport provisioning service in Windows 10 AD FS.
segment.target: Active Directory provides the ability to authorize users and devices using keys protected by Passport if domain controllers are running Windows 10 and the Microsoft Passport provisioning service in Windows 10 AD FS.

segment.source: Passport for BYOD
segment.target: Passport for BYOD

segment.source: Passport can be managed on personal devices that your employees use for work purposes using MDM.
segment.target: Passport can be managed on personal devices that your employees use for work purposes using MDM.

segment.source: On personal devices, users can create a personal Passport PIN for unlocking the device and a separate work PIN for access to work resources.
segment.target: On personal devices, users can create a personal Passport PIN for unlocking the device and a separate work PIN for access to work resources.

segment.source: The work PIN is managed using the same Passport policies that you can use to manage Passport on organization owned devices.
segment.target: The work PIN is managed using the same Passport policies that you can use to manage Passport on organization owned devices.

segment.source: The personal PIN is managed separately using DeviceLock policy.
segment.target: The personal PIN is managed separately using DeviceLock policy.

segment.source: DeviceLock policy can be used to control length, complexity, history, and expiration requirements and can be configured using the Policy configuration service provider.
segment.target: DeviceLock policy can be used to control length, complexity, history, and expiration requirements and can be configured using the Policy configuration service provider.
